text: alright so i dont at all understand how to use vagrant and shit.
i downloaded it and unzipped it with 7zip and then went into the folder and did vagrant up and nothing happened.
I'll bring my laptop tomorrow and we can work through everything together.
Yeah I'm not using vagrant as well :)) osx ftw
If you've got a computer you can use any Unix system on, you can just run that setup script there. I dual boot into Ubuntu most of the time
Oh yeah. That i know. Haha
Meeting tomorrow at 2:20?

I'm back in Winnipeg now, I'll probably stay up for a while to catch up with what I missed here. I had some poor experiences with vagrant with this ucosp project, but you're saying you made a setup script for UNIX systems <@U0HUKEYE5>?
The setup script is for installing node and its dependencies <@U0HULF5R6>
Sweet
on a unix system. haha
I've got an Ubuntu VM on my surface so I should be good to go
:computer:
<@U0HULF5R6> I channelled my inner James and wrote a shell setup script lol
<!channel>: You definitely don't need to use vagrant, it's just my favourite tool. If you want just a vanilla VirtualBox VM, that will work just as well!
He'd be so proud :')
Man, I learned a ton from James. We both really share an interest for security

I might try vagrant out again because I like the idea of it, but there was just an issue for those running Windows 10 this weekend. Apparently there's an existing bug with the ansible provision or something.
Yeah, I'm actually troubleshooting that now lol
fucking windows 10 has been nothing but nightmares. Shoulda stuck with 7
Yeah he's a smart guy, great to work with
I know... It's been a pain for some dev work on the surface, but the UI is so much better on the surface than 8.1
I just do most of my dev on the surface in the Ubuntu VM anyways
Yeah, I really like the look and feel of Win10, but it's just been a nightmare as far as compatibility goes. It made my gaming keyboard unusable for my desktop... :disappointed:
I learned a lot of sweet terminal extensions for Linux from James to make Linux dev a delight
yeah I didn't know about `sudo !!` before James showed it to me
And i exclusively use terminator and oh-my-zsh now
Man, I’m rewritting my resume haha
I lost my word copy for it.
So Im totally just redoing it.

<@U0HUH2B1R>: Did you have any trouble with sqlite3? When I try to run the server I get
```
vagrant@precise32:/vagrant$ node server.js 
module.js:340
    throw err;
    ^

Error: Cannot find module 'sqlite3'
    at Function.Module._resolveFilename (module.js:338:15)

    at Module.load (module.js:356:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:313:12)
vagrant@precise32:/vagrant$ npm install sqlite3
```
install sqlite3
it looks like its not installed?
When I try to install sqlite3 I get a multi-hundred line stack trace
hmm..

ends like this 
```
Failed to execute '/usr/bin/nodejs /usr/lib/node_modules/npm/node_modules/node-gyp/bin/node-gyp.js build --fallback-to-build --module=/vagrant/node_modules/sqlite3/lib/binding/node-v46-linux-ia32/node_sqlite3.node --module_name=node_sqlite3 --module_path=/vagrant/node_modules/sqlite3/lib/binding/node-v46-linux-ia32' (1)
```
